trans-unit.source: Create Azure blob containers
trans-unit.target: Create Azure blob containers

trans-unit.source: In this topic, we create <token>azure_2</token> Blob containers that are required for the solution.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, we create <token>azure_2</token> Blob containers that are required for the solution.

trans-unit.source: We create three containers, one to receive purchase order data before it is sent to the EDI send pipeline, one to receive purchase order data after it is processed by the EDI send pipeline, and one to receive invoice data from Fourth Coffee.
trans-unit.target: We create three containers, one to receive purchase order data before it is sent to the EDI send pipeline, one to receive purchase order data after it is processed by the EDI send pipeline, and one to receive invoice data from Fourth Coffee.

trans-unit.source: We also generate the Shared Access Signature (SAS) URLs to access the blobs.
trans-unit.target: We also generate the Shared Access Signature (SAS) URLs to access the blobs.

trans-unit.source: The SAS URL is required for authentication while writing data to the blob.
trans-unit.target: The SAS URL is required for authentication while writing data to the blob.

trans-unit.source: To create Azure blob containers
trans-unit.target: To create Azure blob containers

trans-unit.source: Create an <token>azure_2</token> storage account as described here: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Storage Account</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/net/how-to-guides/blob-storage/#create-account</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Create an <token>azure_2</token> storage account as described here: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Storage Account</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/develop/net/how-to-guides/blob-storage/#create-account</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, name the storage account at <userInput>cloudcardemostore</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, name the storage account at <userInput>cloudcardemostore</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Create a container called <embeddedLabel>purchaseorder</embeddedLabel> within the <embeddedLabel>cloudcardemostore</embeddedLabel> storage account.
trans-unit.target: Create a container called <embeddedLabel>purchaseorder</embeddedLabel> within the <embeddedLabel>cloudcardemostore</embeddedLabel> storage account.

trans-unit.source: This container will store the purchaser order data received from customers.
trans-unit.target: This container will store the purchaser order data received from customers.

trans-unit.source: Create a container by performing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Create a container by performing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the <token>azureportal1</token>, select <embeddedLabel>STORAGE</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>cloudcardemostore</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>azureportal1</token>, select <embeddedLabel>STORAGE</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>cloudcardemostore</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>cloudcardemostore</embeddedLabel> dashboard, select <embeddedLabel>CONTAINERS</embeddedLabel>, and then from the command bar, select <embeddedLabel>ADD</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>cloudcardemostore</embeddedLabel> dashboard, select <embeddedLabel>CONTAINERS</embeddedLabel>, and then from the command bar, select <embeddedLabel>ADD</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the New Container dialog box, enter the name as <userInput>purchaseorder</userInput> and mark access as private.
trans-unit.target: On the New Container dialog box, enter the name as <userInput>purchaseorder</userInput> and mark access as private.

trans-unit.source: Select the check mark to create the container.
trans-unit.target: Select the check mark to create the container.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step to create two more containers and name them <embeddedLabel>invoice</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>tosupplier</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step to create two more containers and name them <embeddedLabel>invoice</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>tosupplier</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Create a Shared Access Signature (SAS) for all the containers.
trans-unit.target: Create a Shared Access Signature (SAS) for all the containers.

trans-unit.source: SAS is required for authentication while writing data into the container.
trans-unit.target: SAS is required for authentication while writing data into the container.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to generate the SAS, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Use a Shared Access Signature</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj721951.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to generate the SAS, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Use a Shared Access Signature</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj721951.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Azure Storage Explorer to generate SAS.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Azure Storage Explorer to generate SAS.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure Storage Explorer, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=282292</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure Storage Explorer, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=282292</linkUri></externalLink>.
